Article.Abstract: Entamoeba histolytica is the protozoan parasite responsible for intestinal amoebiasis and amoebic liver abscess, which cause significant morbidity and mortality in many countries of the world. Proteophosphoglycans (PPGs, also known as lipophosphoglycans, LPGs, or lipopeptidophosphoglycans, LPPGs) represent dominant surface components of E. histolytica. Passive immunization with a monoclonal antibody (EH5) directed against these components protected SCID mice from amoebic liver abscess, so PPGs might be regarded as vaccine candidates; however, their structure is very complex and only known in part. They are glycosylphosphatidylinositol-linked polypeptides of unknown sequence carrying glycan side-chains linked to serine residues via phosphodiester bonds. In order to identify peptide mimics of the E. histolytica PPG antigens, we screened six different phage-displayed random peptide libraries with the antibody EH5. Various peptide mimics of different length were identified and, in all the peptides, a distinct consensus sequence Gly-Thr-His-Pro-X-Leu could be identified. The phages strongly bound to the antibody, and the natural antigen inhibited binding of the phages to antibody EH5. In addition, several of the phages induced a significant immunoglobulin G response against amoebic antigens in immunized mice.
Article.ArticleTitle: Antigenicity and immunogenicity of phage library-selected peptide mimics of the major surface proteophosphoglycan antigens of Entamoeba histolytica.
Article.Affiliations: Division of Specific Prophylaxis and Tropical Medicine, Department of Pathophysiology, Vienna, Austria.

EpitopeRelatedObject.RelatedObjectType: The epitope is a mimotope of:

Epitope.EpitopeComments: This peptide, along with others sharing the GTHPXL consensus motif, mimics the surface proteophosphoglycans (PPGs, a.k.a. lipophosphoglycan) of Entamoeba histolytica in its reactivity to an anti-PPG monoclonal antibody, EH5.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 3 doses of 10^11 phages 3 weeks apart

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Reactivity to the trophozoites in immunofluorescence assays was observed using sera of mice immunized with the epitope-displaying phage clone.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 3 doses of 50â75 ug membrane antigen preparations, 1st in CFA, others in IFA, at days 0, 27 and 35.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: The monoclonal antibody generation is described in Marinets et al, J Exp Med 1997; 186:1557 [PMID:9348313]. After the immunization and 3 d before the fusion, mice received an intravenous injection of 50 ug, and 1 d later an injection of 25 ug of membrane antigen preparation (containing PPGs) in PBS.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The epitope-specific mAb, raised to E. histolytica membrane antigens and shown to react with the epitope-displaying phage particles in ELISA, is shown to react with E. histolytica trophozoites in immunofluorescence.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 3 doses of 50â75 ug membrane antigen preparations, 1st in CFA, others in IFA, at days 0, 27 and 35.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: The monoclonal antibody generation is described in Marinets et al, J Exp Med 1997; 186:1557 [PMID:9348313]. After the immunization and 3 d before the fusion, mice received an intravenous injection of 50 ug, and 1 d later an injection of 25 ug of membrane antigen preparation (containing PPGs) in PBS.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The phage-displayed epitope was selected from a random sequence library by panning with the mAb. The reactivity to the phage was confirmed in ELISA. Also, the membrane preparation of E. histolytica used to generate the mAb competes with the peptide in binding to the mAb.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 3 doses of 50â75 ug membrane antigen preparations, 1st in CFA, others in IFA, at days 0, 27 and 35.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: The monoclonal antibody generation is described in Marinets et al, J Exp Med 1997; 186:1557 [PMID:9348313]. After the immunization and 3 d before the fusion, mice received an intravenous injection of 50 ug, and 1 d later an injection of 25 ug of membrane antigen preparation (containing PPGs) in PBS.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The epitope-specific mAb reactivity to the epitope is inhibited by the membrane preparation of E. histolytica used to generate the mAb.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 3 doses of 10^11 phages 3 weeks apart

AssayInformation.AssayComments: An E. histolytica membrane preparation which presumably contains proteophosphoglycans was used as the antigen in this assay. Reactivity was detected in the indicated number of responders at day 49 after the primary immunization, while sera from earlier timepoints (days 0, 7 and 28) were negative. Also, the same antigen preparation works as a soluble-phase inhibitor of the reactivity to solid-phase bound antigen and is reactive with the sera in Western blot.
